result.execSummary:
The defendant Dajon Tavion Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs/DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs, assessments and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carrry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privieges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dajon Tavion Davis

records.addlTxt: Order Denying Request to Extend Time to Pay the Fine, Costs and Surcharges in this Action, signed, filed and distributed. LNR
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. spc

Letter Rceived
Address: 2375 north 11th street
Milwaukee WI 53206
Phone Number: 414-699-7513
Original Transcript (19 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 04-28-2016 received and filed.

Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 33 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 116 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 16 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 17 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
             Pretrial Credit

At the request of Department of Corrections, the sentencing date of 3-30-2016 is changed to 4-28-2016 at 8:15 to allow DOC sufficient time to obtain full juvenile records and provide a complete history to the court and counsels.
Atty Sargent and ADA Sitzberger are in agreement with new date.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (23 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 25, 2016 received and filed.

Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.  The court is ordering a PSI to obtain information as to defendant's juvenile record.  Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 3-30-2016 at 8:15  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information previously filed on 1-19-2016.  Defense given copy and waives reading and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Case is adjourned to 2-25-2016 at 8:15 for plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 01-19-2016 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Steve Sargent, 735 N Water St, Ste 912, Milwaukee WI 53202.

Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Allen Tenhaken-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

ADDRESS INFO for Dajon Tavion Davis
Current: 2375 N 11th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 01-08-2016)
Prior: 2549 North Holton Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dajon Tavion Davis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty to misdemeanor count.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
